intro: Vochysia obidensis, commonly known as the Obidos velvetwood, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically eaten by various bird species. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
